Name: clinker production | clinker | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster
Description: Current technology. Clinker is made by heating at high temperature in a rotary kiln a mixture of limestone and clays. In the production of clinker, 86% of the total raw materials are composed of limestone. Four types of clays are used, which come from different parts of ;Ecuador; these clays represent 11% by mass, and other raw materials of mineral correction ;represent 3%.
